meanings.definition: A person who operates a valve or faucet.
meanings.sent1: The turncock turned the valve to stop the water.
meanings.sent2: The plumber fixed the leaky faucet by replacing the turncock.
meanings.sent3: The turncock accidentally turned off the water supply during the party.
meanings.sent4: She was the turncock of the house, always in charge of the water flow.
meanings.sent5: The turncock's job was crucial in ensuring the water system worked smoothly.

meanings.definition: A valve or faucet that controls the flow of liquid.
meanings.sent1: The turncock on the pipe was rusty and hard to turn.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to close the turncock tightly to prevent any leaks.
meanings.sent3: The old turncock creaked loudly every time it was turned.
meanings.sent4: The turncock was the key to regulating the water pressure in the system.
meanings.sent5: The shiny turncock gleamed under the sunlight, a small but vital part of the plumbing.

meanings.definition: To operate a valve or faucet to control the flow of liquid.
meanings.sent1: He had to turn the turncock slowly to avoid sudden water gushes.
meanings.sent2: Remember to turn the turncock clockwise to shut off the water.
meanings.sent3: She turncocked the faucet too hard and ended up with a wet kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Turning the turncock felt like holding the power of the water in your hands.
meanings.sent5: The sound of turning the turncock echoed through the quiet room, a simple yet impactful action.
